body:
1), you might need to use a requirejs call to be sure dependencies are resolved correctly. 
2) Use https:// instead of http. Always use https, never use http. 

That might help, we'll try more things if it is not enough.
@lahlali, excellent, that does the trick, thanks a bunch!!! So does this point to a bug in the `Javascript` object i.e. that it should be using require.js instead of jQuery's `getScript`?

@ElDeveloper I don't think the object Javascript(IPython) has a bug, it is just taking time to load, you'd better use requirejs for its stability. for your question i have no idea about how it is implemented.

Got it, thanks! I had a look at the source while I was debugging this issue last week. Line [540 of display.py](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/e51e50d36f2d05061ef7bdcea56531f5fca08f4c/IPython/core/display.py#L540) uses jQuery to load the external libraries, however I think it would be better if `require` was used here instead (because of the benefits you've pointed out). Not sure what the devs think though, or what the motivation to use jQuery here is.

:+1: 

@ElDeveloper For JS contruction purpose i think. they should rewrite _repr_javascript_ to handle requirejs style.
